page.title: 17Changing Times 1
page.content: {Grace Dixon's}recollections of the changes in{Guisborough}span over{50 {years.}The weekly market,consisting of {mainly}food stalls{concentrated round the{market cross,}extended{late}into each{Saturday evening.}Now many stalls selling a{wide variety}of goods,occupy almost the{whole length}of the{cobbled area on{either side}of{Westgate twice {weekly. {Parking}has become a{major problem on{market}days{especially}during {summer}when there is the{extra burden of{tourist traffic}in{addition}to the normal{heavy traffic}which a main route situation{attracts.The railway {disappeared}about{twenty years ago.
